subject: Real Estate
title: Walt Disney's Secret Florida Land Grab
description: One-minute skill: Walt Disney's Secret Florida Land Grab.

hook.text: Walt Disney secretly bought 27,000 acres of Florida swampland using dozens of fake shell companies.

buildup.text: He learned from Disneyland's mistake â€” once locals knew Disney was buying, prices quadrupled.

discovery.text: Shell companies with names like 'Reedy Creek Ranch' and 'Bay Lake Properties' kept the buyer hidden.

twist.text: When a reporter connected the dots in 1965, remaining land prices skyrocketed overnight.

climax.text: Disney World opened in 1971 on land bought for about $185 per acre. The site is now worth billions.

punchline.text: Mickey Mouse's kingdom was built on deception.

quiz.question: Why did Disney use shell companies to buy Florida land?
